items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from midday today, 08/09/2024. 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. 
We expect river levels to remain high until approximately 17:00 tonight.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.  
To check the status of road closures online, please visit the One Network live map.
This message will be updated by 09:00 tomorrow morning, 09/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Due to heavy rainfall forecast, flooding is possible overnight Saturday 7th September and into the early hours of Sunday 8th September in the area of Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries.
There may be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers.
We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Sunday 8th September, though no flooding to properties is forecast, and flood warnings are not expected to be issued.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels, and this message will be updated on Sunday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes

items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:

"Small, flashier rivers and streams may respond to heavy rainfall as a result of localised thunderstorms passing through the area.  This message has been issued pre-emptively ahead of localised thunderstorms between 21:00 on 07/09/24 and 18:00 on 08/09/24.  Given the unpredictable nature of thunderstorms, there is low confidence in the locations and impacts of rainfall at this point.  Areas most at risk are low lying agricultural land, roads and footpaths close to small rivers and streams.  Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows.   
Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall are forecast over the next 24 hours, with low confidence over exact timing and locations.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 12:00 tomorrow, 08/09/24, or as the situation changes."

items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Axe area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Flooding is possible on Sunday 8th of September. Over the last few days, we have seen prolonged heavy rainfall meaning catchments are becoming wetter. Rivers have risen in response to rainfall overnight. With further heavy rain forecast throughout Sunday there remains a minor risk of flooding.  

Expected river levels suggest that there may be flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers. No flooding to properties is currently forecast.     

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  There may be standing water present for several days, please do not walk or drive through flood water as it is hazardous. We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages.   

This message will be updated by midday on Monday 9th  of September, or earlier if the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ford Green Brook, Lyme Brook, River Trent

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Liverpool Road river gauge in Stoke on Trent as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible during Sunday, 08/09/24.  Flooding will affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Trent between Norton Green and Darlaston including Stoke on Trent, Lyme Brook between Newcastle under Lyme and Hanford, Fowlea Brook at Stoke on Trent and Ford Green Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours, therefore we expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated on 09/09/24, or as the situation changes.
